title: Reinforcement Learning
subtitle: Master Decision-Making AI
description: Learn the fundamentals of reinforcement learning and how to build intelligent agents that can make optimal decisions in complex environments.

overview.description: Dive deep into the world of reinforcement learning, where agents learn to make optimal decisions through trial and error. This comprehensive course covers everything from basic concepts to advanced deep reinforcement learning algorithms.

chapters.title: Introduction to Reinforcement Learning
chapters.description: Get introduced to the fundamental concepts of reinforcement learning and understand how it differs from supervised and unsupervised learning.

chapters.title: Markov Decision Processes
chapters.description: Learn about the mathematical framework that underlies reinforcement learning - Markov Decision Processes.

chapters.title: Dynamic Programming
chapters.description: Explore dynamic programming methods for solving MDPs when the model is known.

chapters.title: Model-Free Methods
chapters.description: Learn model-free methods that can solve RL problems without knowing the environment dynamics.

chapters.title: Function Approximation
chapters.description: Understand how to handle large state spaces using function approximation techniques.

chapters.title: Policy Gradient Methods
chapters.description: Learn direct policy optimization methods that can handle continuous action spaces.

chapters.title: Advanced Deep RL
chapters.description: Explore advanced deep reinforcement learning algorithms and multi-agent systems.

chapters.title: Applications and Case Studies
chapters.description: See how reinforcement learning is applied in real-world scenarios across different domains.

instructor_info.name: Dr. Sarah Chen
instructor_info.title: Senior Research Scientist at DeepMind
instructor_info.bio: Dr. Chen is a leading researcher in reinforcement learning with over 8 years of experience at top AI research labs. She has published extensively on deep RL and has contributed to breakthrough algorithms in game-playing AI.
credentials: PhD in Computer Science from Stanford University
Speaker at major AI conferences worldwide

requirements: Pass all quizzes with 80% or higher
